meanings.definition: A cardinal number represented in the U.S. by 1 followed by 48 zeros, and in Great Britain by 1 followed by 90 zeros.
meanings.sent1: The concept of quindecillions can be mind-boggling due to its immense size.
meanings.sent2: Scientists often use quindecillions to describe astronomical figures.
meanings.sent3: When discussing quindecillions, my little brother thought it was a made-up number!
meanings.sent4: In the world of finance, the value of the company was equivalent to quindecillions in dollars.
meanings.sent5: The sheer magnitude of quindecillions can be hard to grasp for most people.

meanings.sent1: To the ant, the number of grains of sand on the beach seemed like quindecillions.
meanings.sent2: In the vast universe, there are quindecillions of stars yet to be discovered.
meanings.sent3: The toddler claimed to have quindecillions of toys in their room, much to their parents' amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was immeasurable, like quindecillions of tiny stars lighting up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The possibilities in the world seemed as endless as quindecillions, stretching beyond imagination.
